content.description: Tits and Aspen is one of the more difficult routes on Tit Rock. It can also be TR'ed after leading Fun Bags or Escape. The crux comes near the beginning when you must climb a bulge in the route that makes it much more vertical.
content.location: South face of Tit Rock. Left of Fun Bags. Find the climber's kiosk and head east and slightly south to find Tit Rock.

content.description: This route have virtually no placements on it. Up high on the route you can sling a part of the flake with a double length sling.  Scramble up the to the top of the gully on the NE side and climb the flake to the top.
content.location: At the top of the gully on the NE side of Tit rock

content.description: Fun Bags is a great route for 5.5-5.7 climbers to practice their leading skills on. Well protected almost too well.... As in I skipped the first 2 bolts because the start is a scramble. To me this route feels like 5.5. Most climbers agree 5.6 is fair. The route goes through a small bulge mid way up. Huge crystal holds through the bulge make this the funnest part of the route. After the bulge easy climbing to the top Chain Anchors.
content.location: When Looking at the SE face Fun Bags is the obvious Bolted line to climbers left.

climbs.name: Escape
climbs.fa: Tom and Jason Kohlmann, Nancy Hall 1991

content.description: Another easy beginner lead climb on Tit Rock. This route lies just to the right (North) of Fun Bags. It has a little more "vertical" climbing than Fun Bags, but is still a breeze.
content.location: Follow the path to the kiosk. Head east and slightly south to find tit rock. This route is on the east side, near the northeast arête.

content.description: TIT ROCK is a great place for the 5.5-5.6 climbers to practice their leading skills. Climbs range from 5.5-5.10. On the SE face is Fun Bags ( 5.6) very well bolted almost to easy. Route runs through a slight bulge making it great for learning slight bulges. It has huge crystals the whole way up. The start of the climbs on the SE face usual involve scrambling for the first 10-15 feet. Usually not much traffic through this area. Good views of the Rushmore area from the top. Especially South Seas area and Proghorn.
